```{python}
#| label: fig-languages

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Data with updated strength values
data = {
    'languages': ['English', 'French', 'Polish', 'Indonesian'],
    'strength': [4, 3, 2.5, 1]  # Updated values
}

# Create a DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Sort the DataFrame by 'strength' in descending order
df = df.sort_values(by='strength', ascending=True)

# Set the style to 'whitegrid' for a clean look
sns.set(style='whitegrid')

# Set the desired width of the figure (in pixels)
desired_width_px = 640  # Change this to match your HTML column width
height_px = 180  # Maximum height in pixels

# Convert width and height to inches
width_inch = desired_width_px / 72
height_inch = height_px / 72

# Set the figure size (width, height) in inches
plt.figure(figsize=(width_inch, height_inch))

# Create the horizontal bar chart with no edge color
sns.barplot(x='strength', y='languages', data=df, color='navy', edgecolor=None)

# Remove the chart title and y-axis title
plt.title('')  # No title
plt.ylabel('')  # No y-axis title
plt.xlabel('')  # No x-axis title

# Customize the background color and gridlines
plt.gca().set_facecolor('none')  # Set background color to transparent
plt.grid(color='#E0E0E0')  # Set gridlines to light gray

# Adjust tick label sizes
plt.tick_params(axis='both', color='black', labelsize=11)

# Hide the y-tick labels
# plt.yticks([])  # Uncomment to remove y-tick labels

# Remove the border around the grid
for spine in plt.gca().spines.values():
    spine.set_visible(False)

# Set the limits of the axes to match the background
plt.xlim(0, max(df['strength']))  # Add some padding to the right
plt.ylim(-0.5, len(df) - 0.5)  # Adjust y-limits to fit the bars

# Show the plot
plt.show()
```
